title: Unpopular Opinion, but I hate URF this time around because...
body:
TOO MUCH DAMAGE.

Just that.
Yes, I know it's URF, it's meant to be escalated in everything.
But damn, for some reason this time damage is just wayyyy too high from right the start of the game, regardless of champ.

I'm finding it really boring because its literally just "who hits enemy with 1 or 2 attacks first".

There's no purpose of 80% CDR because you don't even get to land a single rotation of spell (regardless of, if you are the one killing or being killed), let alone spam the hell out of spells.

I've been playing URF everytime it came, since past 5 years of me playing League.

And I can say with absolute certainty that damage was never so high in previous URFs (probably not even half of it) compared to what it is this time.

ADCs are killing everybody in 2 autoattacks.
Mages/Assassins killing with 2 spells on average (midgame... which now laughably starts at 5-7 mins)

Even if I ignore the fact that it's all random and match is almost always decided in champ selection screen.

IT. IS. JUST. NOT. FUN.

I'm really dissappointed with this because I've been looking forward to spam URF every day with friends when it would come out.

But the damage creep have been a joykiller.

I just hope RIOT could tone down damage the next time URF comes.

Otherwise, at this rate we will be watching game ending at average 5mins in upcoming URFs.

Are they 80% reduced cd on everything faster? No? Then no
I don't think you understand what a "fast **gamemode**" means.

It means fast, constant action.

Is Poro King's action anywhere even remotely close to as fast and consistent as URFs? No? Then no

The game _ending_ fast has nothing to do with the URF-to-playerbase-decline effect.
No, a fast game mode is in fact how long it takes to play. But even by you paramaters, Poro King is faster than SR, way faster than SR.
Back to the topic and my definition of URF's game pace. Is Poro King anywhere remotely close to as fast and consistent as URF? No? Then no Poro King will not have the same effect.
I think it is, Ascension at least certainly is with people constantly fighting it out.

Fighting it out with regular cooldowns. Same fight pacing just more fights.

URF involves far more actions in fights due to the massive CDR on everything while also having even more fighting than Ascension.

You still gotta wait for your 2 minute ultimate cooldown whereas in URF it's up every 24 seconds.

?

Some may leave because of frustration, but saying it is the main reason people stopped playing the game is just an assumption. I have heard lots of people who came back only for URF for example, and during the period it is active they play the game. Many just got bored of the game afterwards and left it.

And Riot specifically mentioned that it may be more of a "hangover" effect or simply a loss of interest in the normal game because it may feel slow.

The only thing that is clear is that they generally lost more people than they would want and that is the main reason they decided to not bring it back. It has nothing to do with how "fun" or "frustrating" it is.
